info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 23 at 4:17PM EDT until July 23 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 500 PM EDT FOR PORTIONS OF CHARLESTON AND BERKELEY COUNTIES... At 416 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Capers Inlet to near Fort Johnson to West Ashley, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. Locations impacted include: North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, Downtown Charleston, Daniel Island, Fort Sumter, West Ashley, Isle Of Palms, Folly Beach, Sullivan`s Island, Boone Hall Plantation, Mount Pleasant Regional Airport, Sullivans Island, Fort Johnson, Don Holt Bridge and Mount Pleasant Towne Centre. This warning includes the following interstates: I-26 between mile markers 216 and 221. I-526 between mile markers 20 and 31. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so.
